item.title: Helldivers 2 Mod Adding Star Wars Content to the Game
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Clone Wars is coming to Helldivers 2 with a new Star Wars mod featuring iconic characters and droids.
  • The Star Wars mod for Helldivers 2 is gaining traction and generating excitement among players.
  • While still in development, the Star Wars mod for Helldivers 2 has received positive feedback and requests for additional features.

A new Helldivers 2 mod is set to bring Star Wars characters, including the 501st Legion leaders and a few different types of Droids, into the popular action game. The mod is intended to offer Helldivers 2 players a way to live out the Clone Wars in the PlayStation first-party game.

After rolling out to immense success earlier this year, Helldivers 2 was recently struck with controversy when publisher Sony announced a mandatory PSN account linking update . While the highly negative feedback from the community eventually forced the Japan-based company to cancel those plans, the players are still reeling from its effect with the game delisted in several countries. Amid all this, a promising new mod for Helldivers 2 , which adds renowned sci-fi franchise Star Wars to the mix, is quickly gaining traction.

Related
Helldivers 2's Defense Missions Have the Potential to Be Trailblazers

While the new defense mission in Helldivers 2 has been a welcome addition, they only scratch the surface of what a proper defense mission could be.

In a Twitter post, YouTuber ToastedShoes revealed a new mod that gives Helldivers 2 a Star Wars -themed makeover in certain aspects, such as playable characters and in-game enemies. As stated in the video, the mod aims to enable players to "live out the Clone Wars in video game form." It brings playable Star Wars characters , such as Captain Rex, Commander Cody, and Hunter, alongside foes, including B1 droids, B2 droids, and Droidekas, to the online co-op game . In addition, ToastedShoes also uploaded a nearly 25-minute long video showing the Star Wars mod for Helldivers 2 in action.

Star Wars Mod Coming to Helldivers 2

According to ToastedShoes, their team still has work to do on the Star Wars mod and, hence, it isn't currently available for the public to download. The video of the mod only shows some Star Wars -themed skins, with many other items, such as Helldivers 2 weapons , understandably sticking to their default look. However, given that the mod is still in development, there may be chances of more Star Wars stuff being added as the days progress.

The announcement of the Helldivers 2 mod has been rising in popularity and has attracted the interest of players. In the comments on Twitter, users commended the promising look of the mod, calling it "insane" and "absolutely stunning." Other users expressed what they wanted the modding team to add further, with a relatively popular request being to incorporate "lasers." As fans wait for the Helldivers 2 mod to release, they can get their Star Wars fix in another popular online shooter, Fortnite , which recently received Star Wars -related content on the occasion of May the 4th.

item.title: Fan Artist Draws Every Pokemon From Gen 3
item.description:
Highlights

  • Redditor Mtsunami3000 shares impressive fan art depicting all Generation 3 Pokemon in a unique style.
  • The artwork features 135 Pokemon, simplified from game sprites with cool shading, and took 2 years to complete.

A talented Pokemon fan online has shared their impressive piece of fan art, which depicts every single Generation 3 design in their own unique style. The awesome piece expands the legions of Pokemon fan art out there.

Ever since Pokemon made its debut back in 1996, gamers all around the world have been captivated by Game Freak's pocket monsters. The developer has slowly added to its roster with each new Generation, and now, there are over 1,000 Pokemon for players to catch. For artists out there who are fans of the franchise, this is great news, as it means there is an abundance of designs to choose from when creating their fan art, which comes in all shapes and sizes in this community. For example, one Pokemon fan made an adorable shiny Rockruff plush , which is totally different from hand-drawn artwork. It's equally impressive, all the same.

Related
Pokemon Fan Imagines Bulbasaur and Its Evolutions as Ghost-Types

An intrepid artist debuts their first batch of fanart reimagining the original 151 Pokemon as Ghost types, starting with Bulbasaur.

Redditor Mtsunami3000 shared their awesome fan art online, showing off their version of every Pokemon design from Generation 3 . Each design is slightly simplified from its game sprites, using basic shading in a really cool, unique style. The piece features 135 Pokemon in total, from starters such as Treecko, Torchic, and Mudkip, to legendaries such as Groudon, Kyogre, and Rayquaza. According to the user, the piece was two years in the making, after they finally decided to get around to finishing it lately, and the results of their hard work is incredible.

Pokemon Gen 3 Fan Art

Gamers in the thread loved the piece, and gave particular praise to the unique poses that many of the Pokemon have, adding a ton of personality to the designs. These specific Pokemon will be a huge source of nostalgia for many gamers out there. Generation 3 of the Pokemon series began with 2003's Ruby and Sapphire , before later being joined by Emerald . Because of this, these games will have been the first Pokemon titles for many players out there. This makes them a prime subject for many amazing pieces of Pokemon fan art from the community.

With Pokemon Scarlet and Violet 's DLC now released, it remains to be seen what Game Freak's long-term plan is for the future of the series. Gamers have their own Pokemon Legends: Z-A wish lists , with that planned to be the next title in the series, but the studio has yet to reveal plans for Generation 10. Gamers likely won't hear about this for some time yet, especially prior to the release of Pokemon Legends: Z-A .

item.title: Genshin Impact Leak Hints at Major Change Coming with Natlan
item.description:
Highlights

  • Genshin Impact is reportedly making major changes to its approach to world design with the launch of Natlan later this year.
  • According to a recent Genshin Impact leak, the overall design of Natlan will focus more around storytelling with its world design than its past focus on open-world exploration.
  • The leak did clarify that Natlan is not removing Genshin Impact's popular open-world aspects, but integrating the region's design more into its main story.

A recent leak from Genshin Impact is hinting at a major change coming to HoYoverse's design philosophy following the release of Natlan later this year. With only a few months remaining until the expected launch of the HoYoverse RPG's sixth playable region, fans are already being teased about what's to come with the Pyro region. Early leaks and in-game teasers have hinted at the overarching themes of Natlan , with the region's story said to revolve around an ongoing war and referring to Natlan to as a land of dragons. Now, Genshin Impact is changing its design approach with the new region.

Past updates to Genshin Impact have brought a wide and sprawling world for players to traverse within the free-to-play RPG. Genshin Impact has introduced five fully playable regions to the game since its 2020 launch, as well as several smaller sub-areas like Liyue's Chenyu Vale, Mondstadt's Dragonspine, and Fontaine's Fortress of Meropide. Several regions also boast their own fully fleshed-out sub-areas with their own maps, including Enkanomiya and the underground mines of The Chasm. Now, HoYoverse is reportedly dialing in on Natlan's story with the new region's design.

Related
Genshin Impact: Why Natlan's Archon of War Could Be a Game-Changer

The upcoming region of Natlan in Genshin Impact stands out through its volcanic activity, but also for how its people worship the Archon of War.

Genshin Impact Leak Teases Natlan World Design

A recent leak shared by prominent Genshin Impact leaker Uncle Teyvat reveals how HoYoverse is shifting its world design for Natlan . According to the post, the Pyro region will see much of Natlan's world design revolve around its storytelling elements as a focus, rather than prioritizing open-world exploration. The leaker clarifies that Genshin Impact will not be removing its open-world elements for Natlan, but rather structuring the design of the region more around its main story. The post also cites the Remuria sub-region added in Version 4.6 as an example of Natlan's design philosophy.

HoYoverse's approach to world design for Natlan comes as some details about the region have already surfaced. Leaks provided by Uncle Teyvat earlier this year suggest that Genshin Impact may be adding mounts with the launch of the game's sixth region. Natlan's location within Teyvat has also been the subject of rumors and leaks, with the Pyro region believed to be southwest of the Sumeru desert. Natlan is expected to be added to Genshin Impact with Version 5.0, currently believed to be launching in August.

Alongside the addition of Natlan, HoYoverse recently announced another change coming to Genshin Impact with the Version 5.0 update. HoYoverse revealed it will be making major graphical enhancements to Genshin Impact in Version 5.0 , raising the game's performance requirements across several devices. The leak about Natlan also referenced the graphical adjustments, suggesting that enhanced performance within Natlan is a major reason for the change. With just a few months remaining, Genshin Impact fans have plenty of reason to be excited for Natlan's launch.

item.title: Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Player Builds Bizarre Wheel Machine to Kill Lynel
item.description:
Highlights

  • One Tears of the Kingdom player found a way to hug a Lynel to death.
  • They did so with a bizarre machine mostly composed of large Zonai wheels.
  • The unusual contraption managed to delete a White-Maned Lynel in approximately 18 seconds, which is much faster than these creatures can feasibly be beaten in conventional combat.

One creative The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom player has devised a devious device to delete a Lynel using mostly wheels and little else. The footage showing their bizarre contraption in action later made the rounds online, just ahead of Tears of the Kingdom 's first anniversary.

The latest Zelda game hit the market exactly a year ago, on May 12, 2023. Aside from captivating many a player with another take on Breath of the Wild 's exploration-focused gameplay, it upped the ante with a complex building system revolving around its new Ultrahand power. Many fans have been toying with this mechanic ever since, giving rise to a huge influx of wild Tears of the Kingdom community creations .

Related
Rumor: Nintendo May Be Revisiting Zelda: Breath of the Wild For Switch 2

Some new information from a reliable industry insider suggests Nintendo may be revisiting Breath of the Wild for the Switch successor console.

Tears of the Kingdom Player Hugs a Lynel to Death

One such piece of inspired engineering was recently shared by TikTok user Cross.XXX, who put together an unusual contraption for deleting Tears of the Kingdom 's Lynels by essentially hugging them to death. Their device comprises over a dozen Zonai Big Wheels evenly divided across two arms, which are themselves stuck on a pair of Hover Stones connected via a perpendicular cart. The final piece of the puzzle is a Zonai Steering Stick, which allows the weird contraption to be controlled.

When the device is powered on, its two wheels acting as joints make the arms move in a clapping-like motion. The arms themselves are made of perpendicularly angled wheels, which allow them to slowly crush whatever finds itself between them. This concept appears to work extremely well in practice, as evidenced by Cross.xxx's video demonstration of the machine that saw them hug a White-Maned Lynel to death in about 18 seconds. That's a fairly impressive time-to-kill, as even highly skilled players who can obliterate Tears of the Kingdom 's Lynels in traditional combat normally need up to a minute to handle the higher-tier variants of these menacing creatures.

Cross.xxx's contraption thus isn't just incredibly inventive and extremely entertaining, but also exceedingly efficient at what it does, which is the de facto Holy Trinity of Tears of the Kingdom Ultrahand tinkering. While the author never offered any background information on how this contraption came to be, its impressive time-to-kill appears to make it suitable for Tears of the Kingdom Lynel farming , even if that wasn't the original idea behind the design. The device has been circulating online for months by now, having most recently resurfaced on the front page of the r/Zelda subreddit, where many fans offered praise for the "Lynel abuser machine" ahead of the game's first anniversary.

item.title: Sega Insider Teases Two Exciting Projects for Atlus Fans
item.description:
Highlights

  • An Atlus insider teases an upcoming Persona spin-off featuring characters from Persona 3, 4, and 5 in a potential Mario Party-style format.
  • Rumors suggest a potential PC port of Catherine: Full Body, a cult classic puzzle game, could be coming to more platforms.
  • Exciting times are ahead for Atlus fans with unannounced games and ports to keep them busy until the highly anticipated release of Persona 6.

The reputable Sega insider, Midori, has hinted at the existence of a couple of promising projects that could be in the works at Persona and Shin Megami Tensei developer Atlus . If these teases come to fruition, then it could signify that the company's release schedule for the next few years is even more stacked than it already is, which is likely to excite many Atlus fans.

Throughout the last couple of months, Atlus has treated their fans to a number of high-quality releases, including the critically acclaimed remake Persona 3 Reload and the strategy RPGs Unicorn Overlord and Persona 5 Tactica . The company is still set to launch Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance and Metaphor ReFantazio later on in 2024 as well. With all these games, it looks like the JRPG developer's consistent release cadence isn't set to slow down anytime soon. In fact, recent rumors indicate that Atlus is planning to double down even further by annualizing franchises like Persona with the release of new games, spin-offs, expansions, remakes, remasters, and/or other forms of media on a yearly schedule. Aside from titles like Persona 6 , there are two rumored Atlus projects in particular, though, that could end up being a big deal for many fans of the developer.

Related
Rumor: New Persona Game Announcement May Be Coming in June 2024

Atlus may be preparing a new Persona game announcement for June 2024, according to some newly surfaced circumstantial evidence.

In a recent set of posts on Twitter, Midori hinted at the existence of an upcoming Persona spin-off that features characters from the entire Persona series. The notable Sega insider first teased this potential title in a poll she posted on April 29. This is especially noteworthy, considering the fact that Midori previously held a similar poll in January asking Twitter users if they would purchase a remake of Persona 3 FES 's The Answer in DLC format. Of course, Atlus officially announced exactly that with the Episode Aigis expansion weeks later. Midori then claimed in a subsequent tweet that future spin-offs in the franchise would contain "all Persona series characters," but primarily those from Persona 3 , 4 , and 5 . It's unknown if this rumored Persona spin-off is more like the Mario Party -style mobile game that was allegedly in development at one point or the Persona Q games on the Nintendo 3DS.

In addition, Midori also held a poll that might be teasing a potential PC port of Catherine: Full Body , the 2019 re-release of Atlus's cult classic Xbox 360/PS3 puzzle game. While the original version of the title launched on Steam a few years ago, the Catherine: Full Body definitive edition was only released on PS4 and Nintendo Switch in the West. Given that Atlus has embraced multi-platform releases lately, a PC port of this game wouldn't be all that surprising. In fact, if Catherine: Full Body is ported to more platforms, it could even come to Xbox as well.

Atlus Might Have Many New Games and Re-Releases to Keep Fans Busy Until The Release of Persona 6

As gamers patiently wait for Persona 6 , Atlus seemingly has a number of unannounced games and ports in store to tide fans over until the release of what may be one of the best Sega-published JRPGs ever. With all these rumors swirling around, it looks like exciting times are ahead for Atlus fans.
